SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

nz.co.abrahams.asithappens
Class GraphContext

java.lang.Object
  nz.co.abrahams.asithappens.GraphContext

public class GraphContext
extends java.lang.Object

Describes how a DataSets instance is transformed into a graphical representation. This contains a DataSets instance, which only describes the data itself, not its representation. A GraphContext consists of various variables that describe the graphical transform of the DataSets instance and methods to achieve the transformation.

In addition to the data values and time values of collection, each instance also stores the aggregation and interpolation policy settings for producing summary data from the data sets. See the SummaryData for further explanation of these.

An instance also stores policy for x-axis scaling. This can be set to one of two values:

  1. One point per value - where graphical displays should aim to have each graph point represent a single value of a data set. This may result in showing only the most recent portion of the data, or alternatively showing all the data may leave a portion of x-axis of the graph without values.
  2. Absolute boundaries - where graphical displays should aim to display the entire data set.

Author:
mark

                    boolean formatUnits,
                    boolean bottomLeftLegend)
Creates a new GraphContext.

Parameters:
data - the actual data to represent
xAxisScaling - the x-axis scaling policy
aggregation - the aggregation policy
interpolation - the interpolation policy
graphType - the graph type
lineType - the line type
lineColor - the data set colors
formatUnits - whether units will be formatted or raw
bottomLeftLegend - the location of the legend
Method Detail

generateSummaryData

public SummaryData generateSummaryData()
Returns:
a summary of the data according to this graph context

calculateYAxisMarkInterval

public void calculateYAxisMarkInterval()
Calculates and sets the interval between major and minor y-axis marks. The values calculated are: yAxisInterval and yAxisMinorMarks.

calculateXAxisMarkInterval

public void calculateXAxisMarkInterval()
Sets the x-axis attributes to fit the given data. The attributes that are calculated are: xAxisInterval, xAxisUnits, xAxisMinorMarks, and xAxisOriginOffset.

findNearestTime

public int findNearestTime(double minimum,
                           char units)
Finds a "nice" unit-increment value for x-axis markings. The value returned will be the lowest of the predefined set of values for a unit that exceeds the given minimum.

Parameters:
minimum - the minimum value
units - units to check for
Returns:
the nearest "nice" value; zero if none is found (because the minimum is too big for the given units)

findTimeInMillis

public static int findTimeInMillis(int time,
                                   char units)
Finds the time in milliseconds for a given time unit.

Parameters:
time - time value
units - unit for given time value
Returns:
the number of milliseconds represented

findUnitValue

public static double findUnitValue(double value,
                                   char units)
Returns a value adjusted according to the given units.

Parameters:
value - the value in the given unit
units - the unit used as a multiplier
Returns:
the unit value
